comment: very woody, but nice. Also a slight finish of bacon.  Surprising, but nice.  3.0/5.0

Definitely very oak forward. Dryer when compared to the standard Glenfiddich but still smooth with added spice and smoke. Still easy to drink though. At 40% ABV it does taste a bit flat but then again Glenfiddich has always been like that. Not bad but not impressed either.
Shocked I like, logging it so I don’t forget!!! Sweet, no smoke, oaky, light.and Vegas, Wahlburgers of all places!! 🥃🎉
Dufftown Distilleries Walk with Michelle - Dufftown 9/3/2019
Interesting and tasty. But not as nice a run sh as the 15.

Actually fairly impressed. Smooth. Light.  A splash of character.  Not a complex whisky, but has a clear purpose and flavor, which is executed well.  Almost exactly what you'd expect from a 12 year fiddich aged for 2 more years with a more distinctive oak profile.

Has all the character of a Glenfiddich but with more citrus flavors. Some bitterness in the short finish. Overall a pleasant and light whisky but not worth the money. I would choose the 12 year old over this any day for that one has more depth and a longer finish.
Intense for being Glenfiddich, fruity, scent of vanilla, orange. Very nice and long after taste with strong taste of vanilla.

Nose: full, very soft, sweet, round, maple syrup, lots of vanilla, lots of honey, apercut, lots of peaches, some dry fruit, raisins. With water a little sour in the back, 

Palate: soft, round, slightly oily, sweet, vanilla, honey, bourbon like character, nutty, lots of mellow sweet and spiced oak, a hint of bitterness in the end

Finish: long, sweet, nutty, bourbon, honey
The scotch that made me appreciate schotch
I'm not a huge fan of glenfiddich as I find do it too sweet bit this is not too sweet.  Very nice
Smooth, not too peety for a scotch.

Havent had a glenfiddich in years but this was bought for me as a gift and I have to say it surprised me quite a bit! Lovely sweet oak nose. Taste has lots of honey and bourbon and the finish has juicy red apple. No harshness at all, perfect for the patio on a summer day.
Nice if you just want something sweet and oaky

Very nice nose, not overwhelming strong alcohol. Maple syrup, vanilla, oak. 
Medium finish, sweet. 
Definitely a Speyside whisky.  3.5/5

After being pleasantly surprised by my first Christmas gift a few days back (Glenfiddich 12 year old), I could hardly wait to sample this one: the Glenfiddich Rich Oak (14 year old). The nose was moderate sweet, and indeed a bit oaky, but very inviting. 
      Rather full on the palate, it was a bit more woody than the 12 year old, and I even imagine that I can taste both the European and American oak, be it nicely blended together with some hints of vanilla/brown sugar, or perhaps honey? The finish lasted surprisingly long, especially the vanilla flavour, and some spices. It's a tough call, but I even seem to like it just a tad  more than the Glenfiddich 12 year old, wich I like very much, but was a teeny bit more acidic.  Makes me curious about  the other Glenfiddich expressions, though... :)

I'm a genuine believer that Glenfiddich--as a distillery--doesn't get the love it deserves from the whisky snobs. It's damning with faint praise to say so, but there's no one out there who does non-craft presentation single malts better than them. And when they put their mind to it (as with the cask-strength 15 Distillery Edition) they can be *brilliant*. But I have to admit, this one--finished in new oak--just didn't work for me. Colour is strangely orange. Smell is off-brand orange soda, tropical fruits (mango, papaya), artificial sweetener, sawdust, lumber, stale beer. Vanilla and pear that occasionally start to mesh into a fruity, yogurt-y creaminess. White grape, floral, and then something like a throat lozenge? It's a bit all over the map. The taste is light and a bit thin--no surprise at 40%--with lots of sweetness. Pears, apples, peaches, more orange soda, melon, cinnamon. There's a distant resemblance to bourbon (credit the new oak), but it's nebulous. Lemon Lifesavers. But the sweetness goes dry pretty quickly, leaving some bitterness, something metallic, and a hint of fried plantain chips (?). A short finish of bitterness, chalky vanilla, and fruits. I wanted to like this whisky more than I did, but then again, I'm generally not crazy about "new oak" finishes. It's decent enough, but I'd happily take the (cheaper) 15 Solera over this particular experiment

Bold with a bit of spice.
Surprisingly more body than one would expect from 80 proof. Nothing offensive, nothing spectacular, just good, simple drinking.
Simple and sweet, nice fruity aroma, hints of vanilla, oak, sweet dark cherries. Solid entry level whisky

This may not be the norm for Glenfiddich drinkers with the woody almost smoky tang, so it appears quite low on the list but I really liked that but of devil that the wood finish gives. I am an Islay fan though.

Solid 3.5 for me but since I can't give half marks, it rounds to a 4.0 distiller wise -- definitely on the sweeter side.

Sweet and smooth, little alcohol. Medium body.

Clairement meilleur que le 12 ans avec un goût qui rappelle le bourbon, probablement dû au vieillissement en fûts de chêne américain neufs. Je perçois un goût vanillé, mais surtout de caramel brûlé et même un goût d'orange discret

Specially selected virgin Spanish and American oak casks release extra layers of aroma and flavour in this whisky. Pouring medium amber, expect aromas of caramel, toffee, vanilla, new oak and a touch of orange peel; warm oaky flavours with toffee and creamy vanilla on a smooth palate are balanced by a lightly spiced finish.
I don’t remember this scotch very well. I know I enjoyed it yet I likely wouldn’t purchase it again.
Rich and pleasant dram. A bit oily, kinda deep. I love it!
Smooth and spicy. Better than the 15yr
Vanilla, malt have a strong presence at the start.  Distinct alcohol finish.
Spicy chamomile honey, strong but smooth, light smoke, nutty caramel hints. Black pepper.  Highly impressive!
Not as smooth as most but if you add a drop or 2 of distilled water it’s ok. Will only buy if on sale.

Une belle surprise.
Il est rare que j'aime ce genre de whisky, mais ici, les saveurs boisées qui nous enrobent la bouche sont si puissantes et insoutenables qu'elle nous donne quelques frissons. On aime quand des whiskys nous déstabilisent et c'est exactement ce qui est arrivé ici.
Love how smooth and oaky this drink is. Not overpowering but lots of taste to enjoy.
